net.ant.rc.serial

Class SerialDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ant.rc.serial.SerialDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arduino2WDSerialDriver

    public abstract class SerialDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    Base Driver-abstraction class. Unification of hardware types for your application layer. SerialDriver translates app commands to hardware languages. Extend it according to your application. Use HardwareDetector to choose the appropriate hardware extension at runtime.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ant

      • serialCommunicator

        protected final SerialCommunicator serialCommunicator

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialDriver

        protected SerialDriver(SerialConnection serialConnection)
        Not useful from the application. Initialise HardwareDetector and use detector.getSerialDriver() method to access a SerialDriver instance

    • Method Detail

      • sendVectorCommand

        public abstract java.lang.String sendVectorCommand(int x,
                                 int y)
                                            throws CommPortException
        Sends Vector-style command to hardware. Parameters x,y - is shift vector of single joystick. To use 2 joysticks see sendTractorCommand method
        Parameters:
        x - X joystick shift
        y - Y joystick shift
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
        See Also:
        VectorCommand

      • sendTractorCommand

        public abstract java.lang.String sendTractorCommand(int left,
                                  int right)
                                             throws CommPortException
        Sends Tractor-style command to hardware.
        Parameters:
        left - Left joystick speed (Positive values means straight direction. Negatives - forward.)
        right - Right joystick speed
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
        See Also:
        TractorCommand

      • sendEachWheelCommand

        public abstract java.lang.String sendEachWheelCommand(EachWheelCommand eachWheelCommand)
                                               throws CommPortException
        Method for constructing programmatic (not analog like WebRC) moves. This method isn't currently used in any example. But it gives direct access to hardware motors for your application without translation by SerialDriver.
        Parameters:
        eachWheelCommand - Defines speeds for each motor of your device
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects hardware.
        See Also:
        SerialConnection.disconnect()

      • getChipParameters

        public final void getChipParameters()
                             throws CommPortException
        Gets voltage level and temperature from hardware chip sensors. Use it to periodically refresh indicators. And use indicator getters to access values at any time.
        Throws:
        CommPortException
        See Also:
        getChipVoltage(), getChipTemperature()

      • getChipVoltage

        public final int getChipVoltage()
        Returns:
        Voltage indicator value in milli Volts.
        See Also:
        getChipParameters(), Battery

      • getChipTemperature

        public final int getChipTemperature()
        Returns:
        Temperature indicator value in milli Celsius.
        See Also:
        getChipParameters()
